claude-code.note: Native Claude Code Task tool — no key needed

codex.note: Codex CLI — uses your ChatGPT login, no key needed

kimi-cli.note: Kimi CLI — uses your Kimi login, no key needed

claude-cli.note: Claude Code CLI — uses your Claude login, no key needed

aristotle.note: Harmonic Aristotle formal theorem prover — requires ARISTOTLE_API_KEY

gpt-5.3-codex._note: Uses reasoning_effort=high via codex CLI (-c reasoning_effort="high").

gpt-5.2._note: Uses reasoning_effort=xhigh via codex CLI (-c reasoning_effort="xhigh").

gemini-3-pro._note: Uses thinkingConfig.thinkingLevel=HIGH in Google API generationConfig.

kimi-2.5._note: Uses --thinking flag via Kimi CLI for extended reasoning.

aristotle._note: Formal theorem prover — not a solver, used as verification layer in Step 3.5

multi_model._description: Maximum diversity — each solver is a different provider, debaters standardized at 2×Opus + 2×GPT

multi_model_full._description: Different providers for solvers, standardized 2×Opus + 2×GPT debaters

balanced._description: All Claude via native Task tool

max_quality._description: Best from each provider — 2×Opus + 2×GPT debaters for standardized intelligence

formal_verification._description: Aristotle formal verification layer (Step 3.5). Runs IN PARALLEL with debaters — adds zero latency to critical path.
formal_verification._note_speed: Aristotle is SLOW (1-15 min per proof). That's why Step 3.5 runs as background tasks alongside debaters. max_claims=1 keeps it to ~5 proofs max. Each proof gets 10s×12=2min before timeout. Claims still running at RWEA time are marked INCONCLUSIVE.
formal_verification._note_disable: Set enabled=false to skip formal verification entirely. skip_domains can list domains where formalization adds little value (e.g. ['strategy']).
